Identity.History: The American Black Bear is strictly a native of North America, where it lives in the many kinds of forests around the northern half of the contestant. While they are called black bears, their fur can also be cinnamon, yellow-brown or even gray-blue. Black Bears are omnivores, which means they will eat anything from nuts and plants to fish to even ants and bees. They eat over the course of summer and fall, and then hibernate through the winter.
